Steps.Description: Analyze the source code to understand the authentication mechanism.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker wants to identify any vulnerabilities in the authentication mechanism.
StepDetails.Action: Read the leaked source code to understand how the login process works.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker finds that the login process compares the provided username and password with hardcoded values.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that there may be a way to bypass the authentication process.
StepDetails.Action: Analyze the login function to identify any potential weaknesses or ways to manipulate the authentication process.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker discovers that the login function does not properly validate the provided credentials and can be tricked into granting access.

Steps.Description: Exploit the authentication bypass vulnerability to access the secret files.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker wants to gain unauthorized access to the secret files.
StepDetails.Action: Submit a specially crafted request to the login endpoint to bypass the authentication check.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully bypasses the authentication check and gains access to the secret files.
